intro: Mitragyna brunonis, commonly known as Kratom, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves with a waxy texture. The plant contains alkaloids, particularly mitragynine and 7-hydroxymitragynine, which contribute to its medicinal properties. It produces small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, round, yellowish fruits. The botanical features of Mitragyna brunonis make it a unique and valuable species in both traditional and modern pharmacological contexts.
